ovdesc.p:
OVERVIEW
History file of BL.BILL
The individual Bill Registers and Bill Batches are attached and made as a contract through this application.
The id for this application is auto generated once it is defined in AUTO.ID.START and COMPANY files. The id format is BLYYDDDNNNNN.
It is possible to include both individual Bills and Bill Batches in a Bill Contract. When a
BL.BATCH is included in a Bill Contract, the system would expand and display all the
BL.REGISTERS attached to the Batch. Only authorized
BL.REGISTERS and
BL.BATCHES could be included in a Bill Contract.
A
BL.REGISTER or
BL.BATCH already included in a Bill Contract could not be included again in another Bill Contract.
The system would ensure that all the
BL.REGISTERS attached to a Bill Contract (either directly or through Batches) are of the same currency and with same
LIABILITY.CUSTOMER as specified in the Contract. Bills of different Liability Customers cannot be attached in a Bill Contract.
While it is possible to attach
BL.REGISTERS of different
BL.TYPE in the same batch, it is not possible to have a contract by attaching different
BL.TYPES. However, if the
BL.TYPE is of the same product, it can be batched and the Contract can be made.
The system would ensure that all the
BL.REGISTERS attached to a Bill Contract (either directly or through Batches) have their
START.DATE not later than the
VALUE.DATE of
the Bill Contract.
It is possible to include
BL.REGISTERS maturing on different dates in a Bill contract.
It is possible to Add/Remove
BL.REGISTERS/BL.BATCHES to an already authorised Bill Contract.
Copy Option is not allowed in this Application.
After the no of days as mentioned in BL.PARAMETER to move it to history from the date of maturity of the BL contract, these details will be moved to history file- BL.BILL.HIST.

INT.KEY
This is an optional input field. The default mechanism (see below) will happen as per below automatically along with other fields ( INT.SPREAD,INT.RATE).
Default Mechanism
1.
The system would first look for an appropriate BTTC record and take the values defined therein. Then it would use the values defined in appropriate BGC record for modification/override purposes. Finally it could use the values from BL.PARAMETER. It is possible that some of the fields
in BTTC or BGC records are not defined (null values). As a general rule, the system would skip these fields and
use the values defined at the next level of parameter records.
2.
If Bill-Type of all Bill Registers attached to a Bill Contract are same then the system would first look for a BTTC record with key "DISCOUNT*NNNN" where "NNNN" is the value of the common Bill-Type. If there is no such record
then the system would look for a record with key "DISCOUNT".
3.
If Bill-Type of all Bill Registers attached to a Bill Contract is
not the same, then the system would only look for a BTTC record with key DISCOUNT.
4.
The system would first update the Contract Group field in Bills Contract; it would determine which is the first
Contract Group defined in APPL.GEN.CONDITION file (Record Key: BL)which satisfy the Bill Contract conditions.
If no contract group defined therein satisfies the Bill Contract conditions, the system would not update
the Contract Group field in
the Bills Contract.
5.
The BGC file could have records
with key values of either "C-Customer No." or a valid Bill Contract Group. In BGC, the system would first look for a record with key "C-Customer No.". If
the record
does not exist, then the system would look for a record with key equal to the Contract Group field in the Bills Contract.
6.
The values in BGC record fields could in some cases override the BTTC values are in some cases could modify the BTTC values. It is possible that both BTTC and BGC records are not available or that the values for some fields are not defined in these records. In such cases, the values from the BL.PARAMETER file
would be used by the system to default the values.
Validation Rules:
Valid BASIC.INTEREST or PERIODIC.INTEREST key is allowed
To specify PERIODIC.INTEREST key, prefix the "P" with the interest key. (Example: For periodic interest key "01" ,specify it as "P01")
Interest Key is allowed only when the Interest Rate is NULL.

The date when the Bill contract is due to mature. Optional field.
When the user enters a date system check that the date is equal to latest maturity date. Otherwise System Defaults the latest maturity date of the Bill Register or Bill Batch when more than one Bill is attached in the same contract.
Example
Bill no. Maturity Date BR0102200005 20010120
BR0102200004 20010210 BR0102200002 20010205
If all the above BR's are entered in the same contract, the maturity date which is defaulting will be 20010210.
The system raises override when the maturity date is a non working day in the country(ies) defined in BUS.DAY.DEFN.

INT.LIQ.ACCT
Contains the account number where entries are made for the reimbursement of the Interest (together with any taxes applicable to that interest) at liquidation.

The defaulting process looks firstly at the SEC.ACC.MASTER record using the portfolio no. If no default found uses the CUSTOMER.CCY.ACCT record and finally if still no default found takes details from the AGENCY record and NOSTRO.ACCOUNT table. These settings can be overriden by using ACCOUNT.PARAMETER to set the account default method.
In a case where interest is subject to taxes, such taxes will always remain associated with their interest amount and will always be liquidated through the same account.
Thus it is not possible to liquidate interest and corresponding taxes through two different accounts or in two different currencies.
Input in this field will be necessary only when the disposal of the interest is different from the disposal of the principal.
This field cannot be changes once BL contract is authorised.
1-14 numeric characters-relating to a Customer Account or a Nostro Account or Internal Account.
3-10 type A alphanumeric account mnemonic. (Optional input. Default value = PRIN.LIQ.ACCT).
The system will check for account posting restrictions and will require an override if necessary.

TAX.INTEREST.TYPE
Using this field together with the CONTRACT.GRP field it is possible to determine a particular tax code from conditions based on:
General tax type as defined in the TAX.TYPE.CONDITION application Type of customer as defined in the CUSTOMER.CHARGES application Type of contract as defined in the CONTRACT.GRP field.

The CONTRACT.GRP code is determined every time the contract is changed by evaluating the conditions defined in the BILLS record of the APPL.GEN.CONDITION application. (see APPL.GEN.CONDTION for more information).
The value in this field must equate to a record in the TAX.TYPE.CONDITION application which contains tax codes related to customer tax group and contract group.
Whenever interest tax is recalculated the correct tax code will be determined and the TAX.INTEREST.KEY and TOT.INT.TAX fields updated accordingly.
If the calculated tax amount changes between sending a payment and the end of the relevant tax period then an exception will be raised during the end of day indicating the different amounts.
It will be stored in EXCEPTION.LOG.HIST.
Optional input, must be present as a record on TAX.TYPE.CONDITION. The actual TAX.TYPE.CONDITION key value will be prefixed by the "*" character (asterisk).

INT.RATE
This is an optional input field. The default mechanism (see below) will happen as per below automatically along with other fields ( INT.SPREAD, INT.KEY).
Default Mechanism
1.
The system would first look for an appropriate BTTC record and take the values defined therein. Then it would use the values defined in appropriate BGC record for modification/override purposes. Finally it could use the values from BL.PARAMETER. It is possible that some of the fields
in BTTC or BGC records are not defined (null values). As a general rule, the system would skip these fields and
use the values defined at the next level of parameter records.
2.
If Bill-Type of all Bill Registers attached to a Bill Contract are same then the system would first look for a BTTC record with key "DISCOUNT*NNNN" where "NNNN" is the value of the common Bill-Type. If there is no such record
then the system would look for a record with key "DISCOUNT".
3.
If Bill-Type of all Bill Registers attached to a Bill Contract is
not the same, then the system would only look for a BTTC record with key DISCOUNT.
4.
The system would first update the Contract Group field in Bills Contract; it would determine which is the first
Contract Group defined in APPL.GEN.CONDITION file (Record Key: BL)which satisfy the Bill Contract conditions.
If no contract group defined therein satisfies the Bill Contract conditions, the system would not update
the Contract Group field in
the Bills Contract.
5.
The BGC file could have records
with key values of either "C-Customer No." or a valid Bill Contract Group. In BGC, the system would first look for a record with key "C-Customer No.". If
the record
does not exist, then the system would look for a record with key equal to the Contract Group field in the Bills Contract.
6.
The values in BGC record fields could in some cases override the BTTC values are in some cases could modify the BTTC values. It is possible that both BTTC and BGC records are not available or that the values for some fields are not defined in these records. In such cases, the values from the BL.PARAMETER file
would be used by the system to default the values.
Validation Rules:
Interest rate is allowed if the Interest key and Interest spread is NULL

GRACE.DAYS
This is an optional field with the Format nnC or nnW where nn is a number from 1 to 99. An input of 0 is also allowed. "C" stands for Calendar days and "W" for Working Days.
If no value is entered, then the value would default as explained below which is a defaulting mechanism.
If BGC value is defined (not null) then BGC value would be defaulted.
If BTTC value is defined (not null)
and BGC value is not defined (null), then BTTC value would be defaulted. If both BGC and BTTC values were not defined (null), then the Grace Days defined in the
BL.PARAMETER file would be defaulted.
Discount Interest will be calculated and charged upfront based on actual no of day Plus Grace days as specified here.
Validation Rules:
Value of 1-99 allowed prefixed by "C" or "W"
